H0.text: Decreased variations in day length is the effect most likely caused by an increase of carbon dioxide in Earth's atmosphere.

H1.text: Increased average air temperature is the effect most likely caused by an increase of carbon dioxide in Earth's atmosphere.

H2.text: Increased burn rate for incoming meteoroids is the effect most likely caused by an increase of carbon dioxide in Earth's atmosphere.

H3.text: Decreased rate of ozone layer destruction is the effect most likely caused by an increase of carbon dioxide in Earth's atmosphere.

A4.text: Warmer air can also make clouds higher and thinner, and therefore more insulating, increasing climate warming.

A5.text: Earth's atmosphere now has roughly 50% more carbon dioxide, the main gas driving global warming, than it did at the end of the pre-industrial era, reaching levels not seen for millions of years.
